solution_line_template: If Juan takes {time_to_lunch_one_way} hours to move from his office to grab lunch, moving from his office and back takes {round_trip_multiplier}*{time_to_lunch_one_way}=<<{time_to_lunch_one_way}*{round_trip_multiplier}={time_to_lunch_round_trip}>>{time_to_lunch_round_trip} hours.

The time Juan takes to grab his lunch from his office and back is half the time he takes to read a book, meaning he reads a book in {time_to_lunch_round_trip}*{book_reading_multiplier}=<<{time_to_lunch_round_trip}*{book_reading_multiplier}={time_to_read_book}>>{time_to_read_book} hours.
If he has a {total_pages_in_book}-page book, he will read {total_pages_in_book}/{time_to_read_book}=<<{total_pages_in_book}/{time_to_read_book}={pages_per_hour}>>{pages_per_hour} pages in an hour.
